DOC.detailed_description: The overall purpose study evaluate effectiveness psychosocial supportive intervention call `` Living Hope Program '' ( LWHP ) increase hope quality life old adult community-living terminally ill cancer patient . Using mixed method concurrent nest experimental design , 60 terminally ill cancer patient age 60 year randomly assign treatment control group . Baseline hope [ Herth Hope Index ( HHI ) ] quality life score [ McGill Quality Life Questionnaire , ( MQOL ) ] collect first visit patient ' home train research assistant . Those treatment group receive LWHP , consist view international award win video hope choice one three hope activity work one-week period . The control group receive standard care . Hope quality life data collect one week later group . Qualitative data use open-ended hope question collect treatment group . Subjects receive Living Hope Program statistically significant high hope ( U=255 , p=.005 ) quality life score visit two ( U=294.5 , p=.027 ) control group . Qualitative data confirm finding majority ( 61.5 % ) subject treatment group report LWHP increase hope . This preliminary evaluation effectiveness LWHP suggest may increase hope quality life older terminally ill cancer patient home .
